adjectives.description: perspirate (comparative more perspirate, superlative most perspirate)

examples: Terse and perspirate, Murphy's wife takes a swipe at the pistol, but Michael moves out of her reach, and keeping it trained on the back of his father's skull, he repeats his question: Why don't you come back daddy?

verbs.description: perspirate (third-person singular simple present perspirates, present participle perspirating, simple past and past participle perspirated)

examples: The sun bursts out in furious blaze, / I perspirate from head to heel ; / I'd like to hire a one-horse chaise — / How can I, without cash at Lille ?
